intro: Sonchus bipontini, commonly known as the two-lobed sow thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lobed or divided. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sonchus bipontini is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
